prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Abell168-batch1
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: The goal of this science goal is to observe the CO(1-0) line for 17 galaxies and reach a typical rms of 2.2 mJy/beam at a velocity resolution of 25 km/s.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Sensitivity.
Our goal is to reach a 5sigma limit of 4x10^8 Msun beam^-1 for a velocity width of 300 km s^-1 and a velocity resolution of 150 km s^-1.
For a CO-to-H2 conversion factor of 3.2 Msun pc^-2 (K km s^-1 pc^2)^-1 (typical of metal-rich galaxies), this corresponds to a CO(1-0) luminosity L_CO = 1.25x 10^8 = 3.25 x 10^7 x S_CO x nu_obs^-2 x D_L^2 x (1+z)^-3 [K km s^-1 pc^2] (where nu_obs is the observed frequency of the CO line, D_L is the luminosity distance, and z the redshift of the source).
Our 5sigma integrated flux limit is therefore 1.4 Jy km s^-1: i.e., corresponding to rms of ~ 0.9 mJy beam^-1 for a 150 km s^-1 velocity resolution. As we plan to smooth all our data to a typical velocity resoluton of 25 km s^-1, our sensitibity limit must be 2.2 mJy. According to the ALMA Observing Tool, this rms can be achieved with ~2.5 min on source.
Imaging.
This project does not have strong imaging requirements. Our main goal is to recover the CO(1-0) flux of our galaxies, and simply determine the extent of the CO emission. In the most compact ALMA Cycle 2 configuration all the objects will be either marginally or fully resolved, but the emission will always be spread over a spatial scale smaller than the maximum scale recoverable with compact configuration (20 arcsec).
Correlator set-up
The observations proposed here are straightforward. The CO(1-0) line will be observed with Baseband-1 at a resolution of ~1.5 km s^-1, allowing to use the same correlator set-up for all targets (DV ~1000 km s^-1) in a Science Block. The tree remaining base-bands will be used for continuum observations. Each Baseband will cover 2GHz bandwidth and will be centered at rest-frame frequency of 115, 104 and 102 GHz, respectively.
Time constraints.
None.
User defined calibration.
None

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose to use ALMA to perform a CO(1-0) imaging survey of a representative sample of massive (M*>10^10 Msun) galaxies in nearby clusters. This will be the first CO survey of a stellar mass complete sample of cluster galaxies, superseding all previous CO investigations of high-density environments in terms of completness, number statistics and sensitivity. These observations are designed to provide a definite answer to the long-standing issue of the effects of environment on the molecular hydrogen content of galaxies, by quantifying if and how molecules are directly removed from the star-forming disk. As such, it will make it possible to quantify the quenching time-scale in clusters providing unique insights into the build-up of the red sequence. Our sample is drawn from the on-going SAMI IFU Galaxy Survey, the largest IFU survey of nearby galaxies to date, providing unprecedented amount of spatially- and kinematically-resolved measurements of ionized gas, stars and metals in galaxies. Thus, the combination with IFU data will boost tremendously the legacy value of this proposal, making it the reference sample for future ALMA investigations of clusters at higher redshifts.
